comments:

appeared in the error log:

Were you self-hosting and did you have "org.eclipse.ui.tests" project loaded
when this happened?

I forgot to say that if you had "org.eclipse.ui.tests" open and you self-hosted,
then it's a deliberate failure that comes from the UI test suite.
I was not self hosting but I did have the UI tests installed in my plugins dir.
Then this is correct.  This is a side effect of one of the test components.

Could support be added to override this behavior?  I added -consolelog to the 
startup args for the tests and the stack trace appears throughout 
(http://download.eclipse.org/downloads/drops/N-N20041130-
200411300010/testresults/consolelogs/win32_consolelog.txt).  It may obfuscate 
other .log contents.

This exception now logs itself as:
java.lang.RuntimeException: The workbench should handle hostile pulldown
delegates (this is an expected exception from the UI test suite).

To reduce clutter in the log, this now throws the ForcedException described in
bug 77527 (except I still give it a test-specific message).
Also changed the decorator tests to use this.
Bug 77527 doesn't seem to describe a ForcedException.  Do you mean Bug 91394?

Wow, where'd I get that number from?
Yes.

Would it be possible to backport the fix to the corresponding perf branches? We
still see the noise in the performance test logs.
Verified in console output from build N20050509.
Backported to perf_30 (was previously backported to perf_301).

traces.message: The workbench should handle hostile pulldown  delegates.
